title: Former NBA Players Charged in $4 Million Health-Insurance Fraud
sub_head: Terrence Williams was the alleged ringleader among 18 former players who submitted false invoices for medical expenses to the league’s healthcare fund, prosecutors said
body:
Eighteen former National Basketball Association players were charged in an alleged scheme to scam a league healthcare fund out of nearly $4 million, according to an indictment unsealed Thursday in federal court in New York.
The U.S. attorney’s office in Manhattan accused the former players, including guard Sebastian Telfair, small forward Tony Allen and power forward Ronald Glen “Big Baby” Davis, of submitting false claims for reimbursement of medical and dental expenses for services they didn’t receive or pay for. In all, the players pocketed about $2.5 million in fraudulent proceeds, the indictment said.
